chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Juanita T McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The last 5 months the defendant is eligible for The Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).
*Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
*Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds or wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Tremblay, professional contact only.

*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: * FORTHWITH. Huber privileges for work and treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Tremblay.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  The last 5 months the defendant is eligible for The Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring. 

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:  

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work and treatment. 
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Tremblay, professional contact only.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds or wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given. 
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Parties review Presentence Investigation report.  Defendant possibly wants to withdraw her plea.  

Case passed:
Case recalled:
Same appearances:
Defendant wants to proceed with sentencing.  There is not enough time today to proceed.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  The "Party to a Crime" enhancer was orally striked by the Court as stipulated by the parties.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.   Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.   PSI was ordered.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant removed from her Justice Point obligations.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
filed.

Final pre-trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests new date.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Juanita T McAfee in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Juanita T McAfee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
